source_instruction: Summarize Section 453 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If someone intentionally removes a serial number from an item with the aim of committing fraud later on, what punishment can they face under Section 489 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both
source_instruction: Explain Section 489 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a person holds a learner's license, what types of vehicles can they legally drive according to Section 10 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: A learners licence entitles the holder to drive a motor vehicle of one or more of the following classes, namely: moto.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 10 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a witness resides outside India and cannot attend court proceedings, what can the court do according to Section 77 of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908?
output: The court may issue a letter of request to examine the witness residing outside India.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 77 of Code of Civil Procedure, 1908.

instruction: What does 'appropriate Government' refer to in Sections 54 and 55 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: The term 'appropriate Government' refers to the government as defined in sections 54 and 55 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.
source_instruction: Explain Section 55A of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a person's driving license is suspended for 6 months due to a traffic violation, can they still drive during this period?
output: No, the person will be debarred from holding or obtaining a driving licence to the extent and for the period specified in the disqualification order, which in this case is 6 months.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 23 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a person is found selling pamphlets that contain false statements about a public figure, what punishment can they face under Section 502 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both
source_instruction: Summarize Section 502 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a satisfactory disposition is made for a case under Section 265D, what actions can the court take regarding the accused?
output: the Court shall release the accused on probation of good conduct or after admonition
source_instruction: Summarize Section 265E of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If someone gives a counterfeit coin to another person and claims it to be real, what punishment can they face according to Section 254 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years or with fine to an amount which may extend to ten times the value of the coin
source_instruction: What does Section 254 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 state?

instruction: If someone claims they accidentally hit a pedestrian while driving, under what circumstance could evidence of multiple previous incidents where they nearly hit pedestrians be relevant?
output: When there is a question whether an act was accidental or intentional, the fact that such act formed part of a series of similar occurrences, in each of which the person doing the act was concerned, is relevant.
source_instruction: Explain Section 15 (Facts bearing on question whether act was accidental or intentional) in simple terms.

instruction: If a registered medical practitioner is unavailable within 16 kilometers of the crime scene, what can a police officer do to conduct an examination?
output: acting at the request of a police officer not below the rank of a sub-inspector, and for any person acting in good faith in his aid and under his direction, to make such an examination of the arrested person
source_instruction: What does Section 53A of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: If a man threatens to assault a woman with the intention of humiliating her, what punishment can he face under Section 354 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which shall not be less than one year but which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Summarize Section 354 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a couple is seeking a divorce under the Indian Divorce Act, 1869 and they file their case in a district court, can the High Court take over the case and decide it?
output: Yes, the High Court may remove and try and determine as a Court of original jurisdiction any suit or proceeding instituted under this Act in the Court of any District Judge within the limits of its jurisdiction under this Act.
source_instruction: Explain Section 8 of the Indian Divorce Act, 1869.

instruction: If a cheque states an amount as 'Rs. 500' in figures and 'Rupees Five Hundred Only' in words, which amount will be considered legally binding?
output: The amount stated in words, Rupees Five Hundred Only, will be the amount undertaken or ordered to be paid.
source_instruction: Explain Section 18 (Where amount is stated differently in figures and words) in simple terms.

instruction: If someone damages another person's property worth Rs. 60 by scratching their car, can they be punished under Section 427?
output: Yes, if the damage caused is to the amount of fifty rupees or upwards, the person can be punished under Section 427 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.
source_instruction: Explain Section 427 (Mischief causing damage to the amount of fifty rupees) in simple terms.

instruction: If a woman is pregnant and someone causes her to miscarry, what is the maximum sentence they could receive under Section 312?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Explain Section 312 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If John transfers his car to Mary and also gives her his insurance policy, what does Section 157 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988 say about their certificates of insurance?
output: The certificate of insurance and the policy described in the certificate will be deemed to have been transferred in favor of Mary with effect from the date of transfer.
source_instruction: Explain Section 157 (Transfer of certificate of insurance) in simple terms.

instruction: If a person commits a theft while under the influence of a mental disorder, can they be held criminally responsible according to Section 84 of the Indian Penal Code?
output: No, if the person was suffering from unsoundness of mind and was incapable of knowing the nature of the act or that it was wrong or contrary to law at the time of committing the theft, then they cannot be held criminally responsible.
source_instruction: Explain Section 84 (Act of a person of unsound mind) in simple terms.

instruction: If an arrested person does not disclose any friend or relative, what should the police officer do according to Section 50A?
output: The police officer shall inform every arrested person of his rights under subsection (1) as soon as he is brought to the police station.
source_instruction: Explain Section 50A of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a witness provides their evidence through an affidavit, can the court still summon them for further examination?
output: Yes, the court may summon and examine any such person as to the facts contained in his affidavit if it thinks fit.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 296 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a cheque is marked 'Not Negotiable' by a bank, how is it treated under the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881?
output: That addition shall be deemed a crossing, and the cheque shall be deemed to be crossed specially, and to be crossed to that banker.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 124 of Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881.

instruction: Can a police officer break into a woman's home to arrest someone else if the woman lives there?
output: No, if the place to be entered is an apartment in the actual occupancy of a female (not being the person to be arrested) who, according to custom, does not appear in public, the person or police officer shall, before entering such apartment, give notice to such female that she is at liberty to withdraw and shall afford her every reasonable facility for withdrawing, and may then break open the apartment and enter it.
source_instruction: What does Section 47 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: If a witness testifies about a statement made during a conversation, how should the evidence be presented according to Section 39?
output: Evidence should be given of so much of the statement, conversation, document, electronic record, book or series of letters or papers as the Court considers necessary in that particular case to the full understanding of the nature and effect of the statement, and of the circumstances under which it was made.
source_instruction: Explain Section 39 (What evidence to be given when statement forms part of a conversation, document, electronic record, book or series of letters or papers) in simple terms.

instruction: If a case is brought to a High Court for appeal, how should the evidence of witnesses and the examination of the accused be recorded according to Section 283 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
output: The evidence of witnesses and the examination of the accused shall be taken down in accordance with the general rule prescribed by the High Court.
source_instruction: Explain Section 283 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If an affidavit contains irrelevant and scandalous material, what can the court do according to the statute?
output: The Court may order any scandalous and irrelevant matter in the affidavit to be struck out or amended.
source_instruction: What does Section 297 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: If a man has sexual intercourse with a woman without her consent, what kind of punishment can he face under Section 313 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: he shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 313 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a person falsely claims to be a juror when they know they are not eligible, what punishment can they face according to Section 229 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: He shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.
source_instruction: Explain Section 229 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a Sessions Judge makes an order and the losing party appeals to a higher court, what section can they refer to for understanding the Sessions Judge's powers of review?
output: Section 399 titled 'Sessions Judge's powers of revision' falls under the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.
source_instruction: Under which Act does Section 399 titled 'Sessions Judge's powers of revision' fall?

instruction: What does Section 479 of the Indian Penal Code define as a 'property mark'?
output: A mark used for denoting that movable property belongs to a particular person.
source_instruction: Explain Section 479 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a person is caught driving an uninsured vehicle for the second time, what maximum punishment can they face according to Section 196 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine of four thousand rupees, or with both
source_instruction: Explain Section 196 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a bond for the production of property has been forfeited and the surety does not pay the penalty within the given time, what can happen?
output: The Court may proceed to recover the penalty as if it were a fine imposed by it under this Code.
source_instruction: Explain Section 446 (Procedure when bond has been forfeited) in simple terms.

instruction: If a High Court has given a judgment on a case involving a substantial question of law of general importance, under what condition can an appeal be made to the Supreme Court?
output: if the High Court certifies that in the opinion of the High Court the said question needs to be decided by the Supreme Court
source_instruction: Explain Section 109 (When appeals lie to the Supreme Court) in simple terms.

instruction: If a person is convicted of an offense under the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988 and held a conductor's license at the time of conviction, what can the court do?
output: The court may, in addition to imposing any other punishment authorized by law, declare the person so convicted to be disqualified for such period as the Court may specify for holding a conductor's license.
source_instruction: What does Section 35 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988 state?

instruction: If a person wants to file a lawsuit for a small amount of money, which court should they approach according to Section 15 of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908?
output: The person should institute the suit in the Court of the lowest grade competent to try it.
source_instruction: What does Section 15 of Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 state?

instruction: If someone is caught taking a coin stamping machine from a government mint without permission, what kind of punishment can they face according to Section 245?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Explain Section 245 (Unlawfully taking coining instrument from mint) in simple terms.

instruction: If a couple's marriage is annulled due to the former spouse being alive at the time of remarriage, what happens to any children born before the annulment?
output: children begotten before the decree is made shall be specified in the decree, and shall be entitled
source_instruction: Summarize Section 21 of Indian Divorce Act, 1869.

instruction: If a petitioner wants to serve a divorce petition under the Indian Divorce Act, 1869, where can they serve it and how?
output: The petition should be served on the party to be affected by it, either within or without India, in such manner as the High Court by general or special order from time to time directs.
source_instruction: What does Section 50 of Indian Divorce Act, 1869 state?

instruction: If a lower court makes an order in a case and the appellant loses, under what circumstances can they appeal to a higher court?
output: Where an appeal from any order is allowed it shall lie to the Court to which an appeal would lie from the decree in the suit in which such order was made, or where such order is made by a Court (not being a High Court) in the exercise of appellate jurisdiction, then to the High Court.
source_instruction: Explain Section 106 of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908.

instruction: If someone is caught altering the composition of coins by adding metal to them, what kind of punishment can they face according to Section 246 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Summarize Section 246 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a witness for the prosecution has testified against an accused person, under what condition can the court question the accused according to Section 313 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
output: after the witnesses for the prosecution have been examined and before he is called on for his defence
source_instruction: Summarize Section 313 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a person testifies as an accomplice in a trial, can they be the sole witness for a conviction?
output: Yes, a conviction is not illegal merely because it proceeds upon the uncorroborated testimony of an accomplice.
source_instruction: Explain Section 133 (Accomplice) in simple terms.

instruction: If a car registered in Delhi was last seen in Mumbai after being there for over a year, what should the owner do according to Section 47 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: apply to the registering authority, within whose jurisdiction the vehicle then is, for the assignment of a new registration mark
source_instruction: Summarize Section 47 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If someone is kidnapped and then forced into slave labor, what punishment can they expect under Section 367?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Explain Section 367 (Kidnapping or abducting in order to subject person to grievous hurt, slavery, etc.) in simple terms.

instruction: If a person is caught selling counterfeit government stamps, what kind of punishment can they face according to Section 258 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Explain Section 258 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a person is convicted after pleading guilty in a court of session, can they appeal against the conviction?
output: No, there shall be no appeal if the conviction is by a Court of Session.
source_instruction: Explain Section 375 (No appeal in certain cases when accused pleads guilty) in simple terms.

instruction: If a person threatens another with divine punishment for not committing a crime, has the person committed an offense under Section 508 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: Yes, because the section states that whoever voluntarily causes or attempts to cause any person to do something they are not legally bound to do, by inducing them to believe that they will face divine displeasure if they do not comply, has committed an offense.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 508 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If an applicant is applying for a stage carriage permit for a bus with a seating capacity of 50 passengers, what details must they provide according to Section 70 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: The application must contain the following particulars: (a) the route or routes or the area or areas to which the application relates; (b) the type and seating capacity of each such vehicle.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 70 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a deed of sale specifies the price and terms of a house transaction, can a party provide testimony about the agreed terms during a dispute over the sale?
output: No, when the terms of a contract (such as a deed of sale) have been reduced to the form of a document, no evidence shall be given in proof of the terms of such contract except the document itself, or secondary evidence of its contents in cases where secondary evidence is admissible.
source_instruction: What does Section 91 of Indian Evidence Act, 1872 state?

instruction: If a person knowingly provides false information in a court case out of spite, what punishment can they face according to Section 209 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Explain Section 209 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a judge has rendered a verdict in a criminal case, what action is required according to Section 363 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
output: The judge is required to give a copy of the judgment to the accused and other persons as per Section 363 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.
source_instruction: Under which Act does Section 363 titled 'Copy of judgment to be given to the accused and other persons' fall?

instruction: If a cheque is electronically transmitted and later found to have discrepancies between its original form and the electronic image, what action should the receiving bank take?
output: The receiving bank shall verify from the party who transmitted the image to it, that the image so transmitted to it and received by it, is exactly the same.
source_instruction: Explain Section 89 of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881.

instruction: If a person signs and delivers a partially completed cheque to another, under what conditions can the recipient complete the cheque and hold the original signer liable?
output: The recipient can complete the cheque and hold the original signer liable if the cheque is stamped according to the law and the amount does not exceed the stamp coverage. The original signer remains liable in their capacity on the instrument to any holder in due course for the specified amount.
source_instruction: Explain Section 20 of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881.

instruction: What does Section 155 of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 deal with according to the given text?
output: Section 155 of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 deals with [Repealed].
source_instruction: Explain Section 155 ([Repealed]) in simple terms.

instruction: If someone is accused of causing damage to an animal worth Rs. 9.5, can they be charged under Section 428 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: No, because Section 428 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860 deals with mischief by killing or maiming an animal of the value of ten rupees and not less.
source_instruction: Under which Act does Section 428 titled 'Mischief by killing or maiming animal of the value of ten rupees' fall?

instruction: If a person files a civil lawsuit seeking compensation for an accident, under what circumstances will the court dismiss the case based on Section 175 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: if a claims tribunal has been constituted for the area where the accident occurred and the claim for compensation is within the jurisdiction of that tribunal.
source_instruction: Explain Section 175 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If someone knowingly possesses an altered coin, what punishment can they face according to Section 253?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Explain Section 253 (Possession of Indian coin by person who knew it to be altered when he became possessed thereof) in simple terms.

instruction: If a car is being driven on the left side of the road instead of the right side, does the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988 allow for this?
output: No, every motor vehicle shall be constructed as to have right hand steering control unless it is equipped with a mechanical or electrical signalling device of a prescribed nature.
source_instruction: Explain Section 109 (General provision regarding construction and maintenance of vehicles) in simple terms.

instruction: If a car owner transfers their vehicle along with an active insurance policy to a new owner, what happens to the certificate of insurance?
output: The certificate of insurance is deemed to have been transferred to the new owner of the motor vehicle with effect from the date of transfer.
source_instruction: What does Section 157 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988 state?

instruction: If a woman is reported missing and it is suspected she was abducted, what action can the authorities take based on Section 98 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
output: A District Magistrate, Sub-divisional Magistrate or Magistrate of the first class can make an order for the immediate restoration of the abducted woman to her liberty upon receiving a complaint on oath regarding her abduction or unlawful detention.
source_instruction: Explain Section 98 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If an appellant wants to file an appeal against a judgment, what should they do according to Section 382 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
output: Every appeal shall be made in the form of a petition in writing presented by the appellant of his pleader, and every such petition shall (unless the Court to which it is presented otherwise directs) be accompanied by a copy of the judgment or order appealed against.
source_instruction: Explain Section 382 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If an applicant makes an application to a court alleging misconduct against a public servant during a criminal case, can they provide evidence through an affidavit?
output: Yes, the applicant may give evidence of the facts alleged in the application by affidavit.
source_instruction: What does Section 295 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: If a person is asked to swear an oath or make an affirmation and refuses, what kind of punishment can they face according to Section 178 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: {'punishment': ['simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months', 'fine which may extend to one thousand rupees', 'both']}
source_instruction: Summarize Section 178 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If A abets B to commit theft but B intends to commit robbery instead, what punishment will A face according to Section 110 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: The punishment for A would be as per the punishment prescribed for the offence of robbery, since B committed the act (theft) with a different intention (robbery) than that of A (theft).
source_instruction: Explain Section 110 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If an employee is found guilty of misusing company funds under Section 408, what kind of punishment can they face?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Explain Section 408 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a person is fined Rs. 700 for violating a regulation under Section 118, has the court followed the correct penalty as per Section 177A?
output: Yes, because the fine of Rs. 700 is not less than five hundred rupees and does not exceed one thousand rupees, as prescribed by Section 177A.
source_instruction: Explain Section 177A (Penalty for contravention of regulations under section 118) in simple terms.

instruction: If a state government wants to set up a Motor Accident Claims Tribunal for a specific region, what actions must they take according to Section 165 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: A State Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, constitute one or more Motor Accidents Claims Tribunals for such area as may be specified in the notification for the purpose of adjudicating upon claims for compensation.
source_instruction: Explain Section 165 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a promissory note is made out to order, can it be transferred to another person?
output: Yes, a promissory note, bill of exchange or cheque payable to order can be transferred to another person by indorsement and delivery thereof.
source_instruction: What does Section 48 of Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881 state?

instruction: If a person suspects someone they know committed a crime and hides them to avoid legal consequences, what is their potential liability under Section 212 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: The person could be liable for harbouring or concealing the known offender with the intention of screening him from legal punishment.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 212 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a court in another country wants to examine a witness who is located in a state where the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 does not apply, what can they do according to Section 78?
output: A commission can be issued by a court situated in any part of India to which the provisions of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 do not extend, to examine a witness located in a state where the Code does not apply.
source_instruction: Explain Section 78 of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908.

instruction: If a non-citizen commits an offense on an Indian-registered aircraft while flying over international waters, can the offense be investigated and prosecuted in India?
output: Yes, the offense can be dealt with as if it were committed within India where the accused may be found, but with the prior approval of the Central Government.
source_instruction: Explain Section 188 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a legal representative signs a promissory note on behalf of a deceased person and later claims he is not responsible for the full amount, what can be inferred from Section 29 of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881?
output: The legal representative is personally liable for the promissory note unless he has explicitly limited his liability to the value of the assets inherited.
source_instruction: What does Section 29 of Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881 state?

instruction: If a person is convicted of a crime punishable by imprisonment for more than 10 years, can they appeal to the Supreme Court?
output: Yes, if the High Court reverses an order of acquittal and convicts the person for a crime punishable by imprisonment for more than 10 years, including death or life imprisonment, then the person may appeal to the Supreme Court.
source_instruction: Explain Section 379 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a Claims Tribunal awards compensation and also orders payment of simple interest, what factors can they consider when specifying the interest rate and starting date?
output: The Claims Tribunal may specify the rate of simple interest and the date from which it will be calculated, provided the date is not earlier than the date of making the claim.
source_instruction: What does Section 171 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988 state?

instruction: If a defendant is found to be of unsound mind during a criminal trial, what procedure should be followed according to the relevant Act?
output: The procedure for dealing with a person of unsound mind who is tried before a court falls under the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.
source_instruction: Under which Act does Section 329 titled 'Procedure in case of person of unsound mind tried before Court' fall?

instruction: If a Magistrate is unable to make a memorandum of the evidence due to illness during a trial, what should they do according to Section 274?
output: The Magistrate shall after recording the reason of his inability, cause such memorandum to be made in writing or from his dictation in open Court.
source_instruction: Explain Section 274 (Record in summons-cases and inquiries) in simple terms.

instruction: If a car accident occurs and the victim sues the driver, under what circumstances can the insurance company of the driver be impleaded into the lawsuit according to the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: The insurance company of the driver can be impleaded into the lawsuit as per Section 170 titled 'Impleading insurer in certain cases' of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.
source_instruction: Under which Act does Section 170 titled 'Impleading insurer in certain cases' fall?

instruction: If a woman reports an assault under Section 354 of the Indian Penal Code, how should her statement be recorded according to Section 154?
output: The statement should be recorded by a woman police officer or any woman officer.
source_instruction: Explain Section 154 (Information in cognizable cases) in simple terms.

instruction: If an appellate court decides to take additional evidence, what are the options available to them?
output: The appellate court has three options: (a) record its reasons and take such evidence itself, (b) direct the evidence to be taken by a Magistrate, or (c) when the appellate court is a High Court, direct the evidence to be taken by a Court of Session or a Magistrate.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 391 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a state government wants to set up a Motor Accident Claims Tribunal for a specific region, what actions must they take according to Section 165?
output: A State Government must issue a notification in the Official Gazette to constitute one or more Motor Accidents Claims Tribunals for a specified area.
source_instruction: Explain Section 165 (Claims Tribunals) in simple terms.

instruction: If a person commits an offence against the Indian Penal Code while traveling on a train that is crossing into another country, will they still face punishment according to the Indian law?
output: No, the person will not face punishment according to the Indian law as the act or omission was not committed within India.
source_instruction: Explain Section 2 (Punishment of offences committed within India) in simple terms.

instruction: If a husband files for divorce claiming his wife's adultery, can the wife file a counter-claim for relief based on her husband's cruelty?
output: Yes, if the wife proves her husband's cruelty, the court may grant her any relief as if she had filed a petition based on her husband's cruelty.
source_instruction: Explain Section 23A (Relief for respondent in divorce and other proceedings.) in simple terms.

instruction: If two parties in a lawsuit sign an agreement admitting certain facts, can the opposing party still request proof of those facts during the trial?
output: The court may, in its discretion, require the facts admitted to be proved otherwise.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 58 of Indian Evidence Act, 1872.

instruction: If an electronic record claiming to be the Official Gazette is presented in court, what presumption does the court make according to Section 81A of the Indian Evidence Act, 1872?
output: The Court shall presume the genuineness of every electronic record purporting to be the Official Gazette.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 81A of Indian Evidence Act, 1872.

instruction: If a party wants to transfer a civil lawsuit from a court in Delhi to a court in Mumbai, what steps must they follow according to Section 25 of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908?
output: The party must make an application by filing a motion supported by an affidavit. After giving notice to all parties and hearing those who wish to be heard, the Supreme Court can transfer the suit to a court in another state if it finds it necessary for the ends of justice.
source_instruction: What does Section 25 of Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 state?

instruction: If a plaintiff fails to produce evidence on the date specified by the court, what is the consequence according to Section 35B?
output: The court may order the plaintiff to pay costs to the other party for the expenses incurred in attending the court on that date. This cost must be paid on the next date before the case can proceed.
source_instruction: Explain Section 35B. of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908.

instruction: If a landowner accepts benefits from a riot and later denies involvement, can they still be held liable under Section 155 of the Indian Penal Code?
output: such person shall be punishable with fine, if he or his agent or manager, having reason to
source_instruction: Summarize Section 155 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: Can a tenant deny that their landlord owned the property when they first rented it?
output: No, a tenant cannot deny that their landlord had a title to the immovable property at the beginning of the tenancy.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 116 of Indian Evidence Act, 1872.

instruction: If someone damages a section of a public highway causing it to become unsafe for travel, what kind of punishment can they face according to Section 431?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, or with fine, or with both
source_instruction: Explain Section 431 (Mischief by injury to public road, bridge, river or channel) in simple terms.

instruction: Can a court allow a question about a defendant's past criminal record if it is not directly related to the current case but might show their character?
output: No, the Court may forbid any questions or inquiries which it regards as indecent or scandalous, even if such questions or inquiries may have some bearing on the questions before the Court, unless they relate to facts in issue, or to matters necessary to be known in order to determine whether or not the facts in issue existed.
source_instruction: Explain Section 151 (Indecent and scandalous questions) in simple terms.

instruction: If someone falsely pretends to be another person in a court case and agrees to pay money as part of a settlement, what punishment can they face according to Section 205?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both
source_instruction: Explain Section 205 (False personation for purpose of act or proceeding in suit or prosecution) in simple terms.

instruction: If a police officer fails to properly secure a prisoner and the prisoner escapes, what punishment can the officer face under Section 223?
output: simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both
source_instruction: Explain Section 223 (Escape from confinement or custody negligently suffered by public servant) in simple terms.

instruction: If a prisoner is committed for trial but falls ill while in custody, what should the officer in charge of the prison do according to Section 269?
output: The officer in charge of the prison shall abstain from carrying out the Court's order and shall send to the Court a statement of reasons for so abstaining.
source_instruction: Explain Section 269 (Officer in charge of prison to abstain from carrying out order in certain contingencies) in simple terms.

instruction: If someone removes a government stamp from an official document without permission, what punishment can they face according to Section 261 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both
source_instruction: Explain Section 261 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a person is already under arrest and a court issues a writ for their release, what happens if they are kept in custody beyond the order of the court?
output: The person keeping the arrested individual in custody after a writ for their release has been issued would be guilty of wrongful confinement and could face imprisonment of up to two years.
source_instruction: Explain Section 345 (Wrongful confinement of person for whose liberation writ has been issued) in simple terms.

instruction: If a court finds that a failure of justice has occurred due to an error in the charge, what can the appellate court do according to Section 464 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
output: The appellate court may direct a new trial to be had upon a charge framed in whatever manner it thinks fit.
source_instruction: What does Section 464 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: If a person tricks another into signing over their car as collateral for a loan without their full consent, can they be charged under Section 420 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: Yes, if the person induced the other to sign over the car through cheating and without their full consent, they could be charged under Section 420 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.
source_instruction: Explain Section 420 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a customer's cheque is crossed and a banker pays it on their behalf, what happens if the customer does not have the right to the cheque?
output: The banker who has paid the cheque in good faith and without negligence will not be liable to the rightful owner of the cheque due to the defect in the customer's title.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 131 of Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881.

instruction: If a police officer wants to have another officer arrest someone without a warrant, what steps must they follow according to Section 55?
output: The police officer in charge should provide an order in writing to the subordinate officer, mentioning the person to be arrested and the reason for the arrest. Before arresting the individual, the subordinate officer needs to inform them about the order and can show them the written order upon request.
source_instruction: Explain Section 55 (Procedure when police officer deputes subordinate to arrest without warrant) in simple terms.

instruction: If A transfers a bill to B, who then transfers a portion of the bill to C, under what condition can C claim the remaining portions of the bill from A?
output: As between holders in due course of different parts of the same set, he who first acquired title to his part is entitled to the other parts and the money represented by the bill.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 133 of Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881.

instruction: If a promissory note worth Rs. 1000 was given as a gift along with a promise to pay Rs. 5000 later, but the gift value cannot be quantified, what happens if the giver fails to provide the gift?
output: The sum which the holder is entitled to receive from the giver is proportionally reduced.
source_instruction: What does Section 45 of Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881 state?

instruction: If a magistrate records some evidence in a case and then hands over the case to another magistrate, can the second magistrate use all the evidence recorded by the first magistrate?
output: Yes, the second magistrate may act on the evidence so recorded by the first magistrate, or partly recorded by the first magistrate and partly recorded by himself.
source_instruction: Explain Section 326 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a transport authority receives an application for a stage carriage permit and the applicant provides a timetable showing speeds that exceed the limits set by the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, what action should the authority take?
output: The Regional Transport Authority shall refuse to grant a stage carriage permit.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 71 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a person is found drunk in a park and disturbing others, what kind of punishment can they face under this section?
output: simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to twenty-four hours, or with fine which may extend to ten rupees, or with both
source_instruction: What does Section 510 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 state?

instruction: If a court in another country (not covered by the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908) wants to issue a commission to examine a witness in an Indian case, what should they follow?
output: Subject to such conditions and limitations as may be prescribed, the provisions as to the execution and return of commissions for the examination of witnesses shall apply.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 78 of Code of Civil Procedure, 1908.

instruction: If someone tricks another person into giving away their phone by lying about winning a prize, what punishment can they face under Section 420 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years
source_instruction: Summarize Section 420 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a woman from a region where it's customary for women to cover their faces in public appears in court without covering her face, can she claim exemption under Section 132 of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908?
output: Yes, if the customs and manners of the region require women to not appear in public uncovered, then the woman can claim exemption from personal appearance in Court as per Section 132 of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908.
source_instruction: Explain Section 132 (Exemption of certain women from personal appearance) in simple terms.

instruction: If a person is found guilty of giving a bribe during an election, what kind of punishment can they face according to Section 171E of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both
source_instruction: Explain Section 171E of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a couple's joint property is involved in a divorce case under the Hindu Marriage Act, 1955, what can the court do according to Section 27?
output: The court may make such provisions in the decree as it deems just and proper with respect to any property presented, at or about the time of marriage, which may belong jointly to both the husband and the wife.
source_instruction: Explain Section 27 (Disposal of property.) in simple terms.

instruction: What happens if someone finds property and cannot prove its legal acquisition after six months?
output: The Magistrate may direct that the property be at the disposal of the State Government and sell it. The proceeds will then be handled according to regulations set forth.
source_instruction: Explain Section 458 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a document is filed in court and the prosecution admits its genuineness, what can happen next according to the statute?
output: The document may be read in evidence in any inquiry, trial or other proceeding under this Code without proof of the signature of the person to whom it purports to be signed.
source_instruction: What does Section 294 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: What can a State Government do under Section 176 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: a State Government may make rules for the purpose of carrying into effect the provisions of sections 165 to 174
source_instruction: Summarize Section 176 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a civil case is being tried and the court realizes additional evidence needs to be presented after the main hearing, under which section can the judge order for supplemental proceedings?
output: Section 94 titled 'Supplemental proceedings' falls under the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908.
source_instruction: Under which Act does Section 94 titled 'Supplemental proceedings' fall?

instruction: How can you prove the contents of an electronic record according to Section 65A of the Indian Evidence Act, 1872?
output: The contents of electronic records may be proved in accordance with the provisions of section 65B.
source_instruction: Explain Section 65A (Special provisions as to evidence relating to electronic record) in simple terms.

instruction: If someone possesses counterfeit currency knowing that it was obtained through forgery, what punishment can they face according to Section 252?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years
source_instruction: Summarize Section 252 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If someone spreads false rumors about me online, does that fall under defamation according to Section 499 of the Indian Penal Code?
output: Yes, if the false rumors made or published by someone online intend to harm or have reason to believe they will harm your reputation, then it falls under defamation as per Section 499 of the Indian Penal Code.
source_instruction: Explain Section 499 (Defamation) in simple terms.

instruction: If a person has been sentenced to 2 years in prison for non-payment of a fine and has already served 1 year, how much of the fine does he need to pay to get out of jail early according to Section 69?
output: Since the person has already served 1 year out of the 2-year sentence, they have 1 year left if the fine is not paid. To terminate the remaining imprisonment under Section 69, the person needs to pay an amount of fine such that the time already served (1 year) plus the time to serve (which should now be less than 1 year due to partial payment) equals at least half of the total fine period (since 1 year is half of 2 years). Therefore, the person needs to pay enough fine so that the remaining term of imprisonment is not less than 1 year.
source_instruction: Explain Section 69 (Termination of imprisonment on payment of proportional part of fine) in simple terms.

instruction: If a person accepts a bill of exchange and fails to make the payment at maturity, what is their obligation under the statute?
output: The acceptor of a bill of exchange at or after maturity is bound to pay the amount thereof to the holder on demand.
source_instruction: What does Section 32 of Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881 state?

instruction: Which of the following is considered a public document according to Section 74 of the Indian Evidence Act, 1872?
output: Documents forming the acts, or records of the acts of the sovereign authority, of official bodies and tribunals, and of public officers, legislative, judicial and executive, of any part of India or of the Commonwealth, or of a foreign country.
source_instruction: Explain Section 74 (Public documents) in simple terms.

instruction: If a person deliberately avoids receiving a court summons and is later caught, what kind of punishment can they face according to Section 172?
output: simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both
source_instruction: Explain Section 172 (Absconding to avoid service of summons or other proceeding) in simple terms.

instruction: If someone is found carrying arms during a procession without proper authorization, what punishment can they face according to Section 153AA of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months and with fine which may extend to two thousand rupees
source_instruction: What does Section 153AA of Indian Penal Code, 1860 state?

instruction: If an accused pleads guilty to a charge under Section 375 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973, can an appeal be filed against the conviction?
output: No, an appeal cannot be filed against the conviction if the accused pleads guilty under Section 375 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.
source_instruction: Under which Act does Section 375 titled 'No appeal in certain cases when accused pleads guilty' fall?

instruction: If a document has a digital signature, under what circumstances can the court require the signatory to provide proof of their identity?
output: The court may direct the signatory or the Certifying Authority to produce the Digital Signature Certificate in order to verify the digital signature.
source_instruction: Explain Section 73A (Proof as to verification of digital signature) in simple terms.

instruction: If a promissory note specifies an annual interest rate of 10% and the principal amount is Rs. 5000, how much interest should be calculated if the note was issued on January 1st and the holder demands payment on June 30th?
output: The interest should be calculated at the rate of 10% on the principal amount of Rs. 5000 from January 1st to June 30th. This period covers 6 months out of a year. Therefore, the interest would be (10/100) * 5000 * (6/12) = Rs. 250.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 79 of Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881.

instruction: If a person is accused of an offense punishable with life imprisonment, what must happen before they can be granted bail?
output: The High Court or the Court of Session shall, before granting bail, give notice of the application for bail to the Public Prosecutor unless it is, for reasons to be recorded in writing, of opinion that it is not practicable to give such notice.
source_instruction: What does Section 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: Can an accomplice's testimony alone be used to convict someone under the Indian Evidence Act, 1872?
output: Yes, a conviction is not illegal merely because it proceeds upon the uncorroborated testimony of an accomplice.
source_instruction: What does Section 133 of Indian Evidence Act, 1872 state?

instruction: If an offender is found guilty under a provision of the Indian Penal Code where no specific fine amount is mentioned, what can be said about the maximum fine they could face?
output: The amount of fine to which the offender is liable is unlimited, but shall not be excessive.
source_instruction: What does Section 63 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 state?

instruction: Can a witness be questioned during cross-examination about their financial status if they are accused of theft?
output: Yes, a witness can be questioned about their financial status as it tends to discover who they are and what is their position in life.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 146 of Indian Evidence Act, 1872.

instruction: If A presents a dishonored cheque to B (the drawer) for payment and B pays A, what can A do under Section 114 of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881?
output: A is entitled to all the rights, in respect of the bill, of the holder at the time of such payment.
source_instruction: What does Section 114 of Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881 state?

instruction: If a witness resides in a state where the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 does not apply, who should issue the commission?
output: If the witness is in India, but in a State or an area to which this Code does not extend, the commission shall be directed to such Court or officer
source_instruction: Summarize Section 285 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If an employee at a mint intentionally causes coins to be lighter than the legal standard, what punishment can they face according to Section 244?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Explain Section 244 (Person employed in mint causing coin to be of different weight or composition from that fixed by law) in simple terms.

instruction: If a magistrate receives a surety from a defendant's friend but later finds out that the surety is not suitable, what steps must the magistrate follow according to Section 121?
output: The magistrate shall either hold an enquiry on oath into the fitness of the surety or cause such inquiry to be held and a report to be made thereon by a Magistrate subordinate to him. Such Magistrate shall, before holding the inquiry, give reasonable notice to the surety and to the person by whom the surety was offered and shall, in making the inquiry, record the substance of the evidence adduced before him. If the Magistrate is satisfied, after considering the evidence so adduced either before him or before, a Magistrate deputed under Sub-Section (1), and the report of such Magistrate (if any), that the surety is an unfit person for the purposes of the bond, he shall make an order refusing to accept or rejecting, as the case may be, such surety and recording his reasons for so doing.
source_instruction: Explain Section 121 (Power to reject sureties) in simple terms.

instruction: If someone intentionally breaks a window in a mosque knowing that Muslims will find it offensive, what punishment can they face under Section 295 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both
source_instruction: Explain Section 295 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If an employee at a mint accidentally causes coins to have a slightly different weight than specified due to a machine error, will they be charged under Section 244?
output: No, because the section requires the act to be done with the intention of causing the coin to be of a different weight.
source_instruction: Explain Section 244 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a petitioner in an Indian Divorce Act, 1869 case has committed adultery themselves, will the court still dissolve the marriage?
output: No, the court shall not pronounce a decree declaring the marriage to be dissolved if it finds that the petitioner has, during the marriage, been guilty of adultery.
source_instruction: What does Section 14 of Indian Divorce Act, 1869 state?

instruction: If someone removes the government stamp mark from a document and uses it without paying the required tax, what punishment can they face according to Section 263?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both
source_instruction: Explain Section 263 (Erasure of mark denoting that stamp has been used) in simple terms.

instruction: If a couple is going through a divorce under the Hindu Marriage Act, 1955, how long does the court have to dispose of an application regarding the maintenance and education of minor children before the main proceeding?
output: as far as possible, within sixty days from the date of service of notice on the respondent.
source_instruction: What does Section 26 of Hindu Marriage Act, 1955 state?

instruction: If someone plans to shoot another person but misses and instead causes serious injury, what punishment can they face according to Section 308?
output: He shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.
source_instruction: Explain Section 308 (Attempt to commit culpable homicide) in simple terms.

instruction: If a person is found guilty of bribery under Section 171E and is sentenced to pay a fine of Rs. 50,000, what additional punishment can they face according to the statute?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year
source_instruction: Summarize Section 171E of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a driver's license is revoked and they appeal, will the revocation take effect immediately?
output: No, the revocation shall remain in force pending the disposal of the appeal unless the prescribed appellate authority otherwise directs.
source_instruction: Explain Section 214 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If an insurance company needs to maintain records of policies issued under this chapter, what can they include in these records according to Section 164C?
output: The records to be maintained by insurers of policies of insurance issued under this Chapter.
source_instruction: What does Section 164C of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988 state?

instruction: If a person is charged with multiple offenses under a single charge and convicted for one of those offenses, can the prosecution still pursue the other offenses?
output: The prosecution can withdraw the remaining charges with the consent of the court, or the court may stay the inquiry or trial into such charges on its own accord. In either case, such withdrawal will have the effect of an acquittal on such charges, unless the conviction is set aside.
source_instruction: Explain Section 224 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: What actions can a police officer take if they find someone in a place suspected of containing stolen property?
output: to take into custody and carry before a Magistrate every person found in such place who appears to have been privy to the deposit, sale or production of any such property or article knowing or having reasonable cause to suspect it to be stolen property
source_instruction: Explain Section 94 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a person is arrested under Chapter V of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 for contempt of court, which sections should govern the arrest?
output: Sections 55, 57 and 59 shall apply, so far as may be, to all persons arrested under this Code.
source_instruction: Explain Section 134 of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908.

instruction: If a cheque is made out to 'bearer' but later has an endorsement in full, how can the drawee be discharged according to Section 85?
output: The drawee is discharged by payment in due course to the bearer thereof, notwithstanding any endorsement whether in full or in blank appearing thereon.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 85 of Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881.

instruction: If someone gives a reward to a detective who helps find stolen goods, but later refuses to report the thief, what punishment can they face according to Section 215 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: punishment with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both
source_instruction: Explain Section 215 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If the state government declares that a certain amount of wheat is needed for the cultivation of land and the support of a judgment debtor and their family, what can they do under Section 61?
output: the State Government may, by general or special order published in the Official Gazette, declare that such portion of agricultural produce, or of any class of agricultural produce, as may appear to the State Government to be necessary for the purpose of providing until the next harvest for the due cultivation of the land and for the support of the judgment-debtor and his family, shall, in the
source_instruction: Summarize Section 61 of Code of Civil Procedure, 1908.

instruction: If a document purports to be a statement made by an accused person during police interrogation, what presumptions can a court make based on Section 80 of the Indian Evidence Act, 1872?
output: The court shall presume that the document is genuine; that any statements as to the circumstances under which it was taken, purporting to be made by the person signing it, are true, and that such statement was duly taken.
source_instruction: What does Section 80 of Indian Evidence Act, 1872 state?

instruction: If a person is driving recklessly and causes an accident resulting in minor injuries, what punishment can they face under Section 279 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both
source_instruction: Summarize Section 279 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a District Court is faced with a legal question during a divorce proceeding under the Indian Divorce Act, 1869, what can they do according to Section 9?
output: The District Court may, either of its own motion or on the application of any of the parties, draw up a statement of the case and refer it, with the Court's own opinion thereon, to the decision of the High Court.
source_instruction: What does Section 9 of Indian Divorce Act, 1869 state?

instruction: Can a wife testify in a criminal case against her husband under the Indian Evidence Act, 1872?
output: Yes, according to the Indian Evidence Act, 1872, the husband or wife of any party to a criminal proceeding can be a competent witness against each other.
source_instruction: What does Section 120 of Indian Evidence Act, 1872 state?

instruction: If someone enters a house without permission intending to steal, what punishment can they face under Section 451 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Explain Section 451 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a person takes a child who is under 16 years old (male) or under 18 years old (female) and uses them for begging, what punishment can they face according to Section 363A?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: What does Section 363A of Indian Penal Code, 1860 state?

instruction: If a suspect is identified through an identification parade and the witness is blind, what additional measures should be taken according to Section 54A?
output: The identification process shall take place under the supervision of a Judicial Magistrate who shall take appropriate steps to ensure that such person identifies the person arrested using methods that person is comfortable with. Additionally, the identification process shall be video graphed.
source_instruction: Explain Section 54A (Identification of person arrested) in simple terms.

instruction: If a suspect is released on bail and fails to appear in court, what happens according to Section 441?
output: The bond of the accused and sureties will still be binding, and they will have to ensure that the accused appears in court when called upon.
source_instruction: Explain Section 441 (Bond of accused and sureties) in simple terms.

instruction: In what scenario might a judge allow evidence of a fact under Section 136 of the Indian Evidence Act, 1872?
output: The judge may allow evidence of a fact if he thinks that the fact, if proved, would be relevant.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 136 of Indian Evidence Act, 1872.

instruction: If a person applies for a private service vehicle permit and specifies a route in their application, can the Regional Transport Authority (RTA) grant the permit for a different route?
output: No, the Regional Transport Authority (RTA) cannot grant a private service vehicle permit for a route not specified in the application.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 76 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a person fraudulently obtains a decree for an amount larger than what was actually due from another party, what punishment can they face according to Section 210 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both
source_instruction: Explain Section 210 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a contract document states 'delivery within 30 days' and there were no deliveries made, what can be used as evidence according to Section 95 of the Indian Evidence Act, 1872?
output: evidence may be given to show that the phrase 'delivery within 30 days' was used in a peculiar sense.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 95 of Indian Evidence Act, 1872.

instruction: If a company based in Delhi has a decree from a court in Mumbai, under what circumstances can the court in Mumbai transfer the decree to a court in Bangalore?
output: The court in Mumbai can transfer the decree to a court in Bangalore if the company has property within the local limits of the jurisdiction of the court in Bangalore, or if the decree directs the sale or delivery of immovable property situated outside the local limits of the jurisdiction of the court in Mumbai, or if the court in Mumbai considers for any other reason, which it shall record in writing, that the decree should be executed by the court in Bangalore.
source_instruction: Explain Section 39 (Transfer of decree) in simple terms.

instruction: If a person is found guilty of committing criminal breach of trust under Section 406, what kind of punishment can they face?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both
source_instruction: Explain Section 406 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a person is found guilty of undue influence at an election and also pays a fine, what is the maximum sentence they can receive?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year or with fine, or with both
source_instruction: Explain Section 171F of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If 'expression' is defined in an Explanation to the Indian Penal Code, 1860, how should it be interpreted throughout the code?
output: In every part of the Indian Penal Code, 1860, an 'expression' as explained in any part of this Code shall be used consistently with its given meaning.
source_instruction: What does Section 7 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 state?

instruction: If someone is caught in the act of printing counterfeit currency notes but has not yet completed all parts of the process, what punishment can they face according to Section 489A?
output: imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.
source_instruction: Explain Section 489A of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a registered medical practitioner is unavailable within 16 kilometers of the crime scene, which type of individual can perform the examination required under Section 53A?
output: any other registered medical practitioner, acting at the request of a police officer not below the rank of a sub-inspector, and for any person acting in good faith in his aid and under his direction
source_instruction: Explain Section 53A of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If someone threatens to harm you unless you give them your phone, have they committed extortion according to Section 383?
output: Yes, if the person intentionally puts you in fear of injury and thereby dishonestly induces you to deliver your phone, they have committed extortion.
source_instruction: Explain Section 383 (Extortion) in simple terms.

instruction: If a court grants a final decree in an insolvency case declaring someone to be the sole owner of a piece of land, how can this decree be used in a future legal dispute?
output: This decree is relevant and can be used as conclusive proof that the person became the sole owner of the land at the time the decree was issued.
source_instruction: Explain Section 41 (Relevancy of certain judgments in probate, etc., jurisdiction) in simple terms.

instruction: What happens when an indorser signs an instrument in blank? How does this differ from signing 'in full'?
output: An indorser who signs their name only without any additional directions regarding payment is said to have made an indorsement 'in blank'. On the other hand, if the indorser adds a direction to pay the amount mentioned in the instrument to, or to the order of, a specified person, then the indorsement is said to be 'in full'. In both cases, the person specified for receiving the payment becomes the indorsee.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 16 of Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881.

instruction: If a police officer reports an offense under Section 193 of the Indian Penal Code, can another police station file charges based on the same incident?
output: No, another police station cannot file charges based on the same incident reported by a police officer since the complaint needs to be in writing and filed by the concerned public servant or someone subordinate to them.
source_instruction: Explain Section 195 (Prosecution for contempt of lawful authority of public servants, for offences against public justice and for offences relating to documents given in evidence) in simple terms.

instruction: If an offense is committed against a Revenue Court, under which court can one appeal if they disagree with the prosecution?
output: such Court shall be deemed to be subordinate to the civil or Revenue Court according to the nature of the case or proceeding in connection with which the offence is alleged to have been committed.
source_instruction: Explain Section 195 (Prosecution for contempt of lawful authority of public servants, for offences against public justice and for offences relating to documents given in evidence) in simple terms.

instruction: If someone is caught with counterfeit government stamps but claims they were unaware of their forgery, what punishment can they face under Section 259?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Explain Section 259 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a driver commits an offense under Section 183 and is not warned at the time of the offense, what steps can the prosecution take to ensure the driver is notified?
output: Within fourteen days from the commission of the offense, a notice specifying the nature of the offense and the time and place where it is alleged to have been committed should be served on or sent by registered post to the driver or the person registered as the owner of the vehicle at the time of the commission of the offense.
source_instruction: Explain Section 209 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If two people plan to commit theft and one of them breaks into a house while the other watches from a distance, does the watching person commit the theft under Section 37?
output: Yes, the watching person can be considered to have committed the theft as they intentionally cooperated in the commission of the offence by doing one of the acts constituting the theft, even if they did not physically enter the house.
source_instruction: Explain Section 37 (Co-operation by doing one of several acts constituting an offence) in simple terms.

instruction: If someone points an empty gun at another person during a joke, can they be charged under Section 351 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: Yes, if the person pointing the empty gun intends or knows it to be likely that the other person will apprehend that they are about to use criminal force, then they may be charged under Section 351 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 351 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If someone helps their friend hide a stolen bicycle and believes it to be stolen, what punishment can they face under Section 414 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both
source_instruction: Explain Section 414 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If someone fails to pay a debt they legally owe, can they be held liable under Section 43 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: Yes, if failing to pay a debt one legally owes is considered an 'illegal' act as per the definition given in Section 43, then the person may be deemed 'legally bound to do' what they are illegally omitting, i.e., paying the debt.
source_instruction: Explain Section 43 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If an electronic record five years old is produced from a proper custody and has a digital signature, what can the court presume according to Section 90A?
output: The court may presume that the digital signature on the electronic record was affixed by the person whose signature it purports to be or by someone authorized by them.
source_instruction: Explain Section 90A (Presumption as to electronic records five years old) in simple terms.

instruction: If an insurer issues a certificate of insurance stating certain coverage limits but later issues a policy with lower coverage limits, how is the policy treated according to Section 156 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: The policy shall, as between the insurer and any other person except the insured, be deemed to be in terms conforming in all respects with the particulars stated in the certificate.
source_instruction: What does Section 156 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988 state?

instruction: If a couple's divorce case is being heard in a District Court, what can the court do regarding their minor children during the proceedings?
output: The court may make interim orders with respect to the custody, maintenance and education of the minor children, whose parents' marriage is the subject of the suit.
source_instruction: What does Section 43 of Indian Divorce Act, 1869 state?

instruction: If someone is caught in the act of making fake coins but has not completed all steps of counterfeiting, what punishment can they face according to Section 232?
output: imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.
source_instruction: Explain Section 232 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a couple got married after 1955 and their marriage is found to have contravened one of the conditions specified in clause (i), (iv) and (v) of section 5, what can happen according to the Hindu Marriage Act, 1955?
output: The marriage can be declared null and void on a petition presented by either party.
source_instruction: What does Section 11 of Hindu Marriage Act, 1955 state?

instruction: What remedy does a wife have if her husband or his creditors seize her property after a court order?
output: The wife can sue for the specific property to be returned or delivered to her and can also claim a sum equal to double its value.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 30 of Indian Divorce Act, 1869.

instruction: If a document is classified as a 'draft' under Section 85A, how does Section 131A affect its treatment under the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881?
output: Any draft, as defined in section 85A, will be treated as if it were a cheque for the purposes of this chapter.
source_instruction: Explain Section 131A of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881.

instruction: If a constable conducts an investigation under Chapter 12 and finds evidence of a crime, what is required according to Section 168?
output: The constable is required to report the result of the investigation to the officer in charge of the police station.
source_instruction: Explain Section 168 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a person believes they might be arrested for a non-bailable offense, what steps can they take according to Section 438?
output: The person may apply to the High Court or the Court of Session for a direction that in the event of such arrest, they should be released on bail. The court will consider certain factors before making a decision.
source_instruction: Explain Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a person is granted anticipatory bail and later arrested without a warrant, what happens next according to the statute?
output: If a person is granted anticipatory bail and later arrested without a warrant, they shall be released on bail if they are prepared to give bail at the time of arrest or while in police custody.
source_instruction: Explain Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a couple obtains a decree nisi through collusion, what can the court do during the waiting period?
output: During the waiting period, any person shall be at liberty, in such manner as the High Court by general or special order from time to time directs, to show cause why the said decree should not be made absolute by reason of the same having been obtained by collusion or by reason of material facts not being brought before the Court.
source_instruction: Explain Section 16 of the Indian Divorce Act, 1869.

instruction: If a witness claims that a certain agreement regarding land ownership was made verbally rather than in writing, what can the opposing party do according to Section 144 of the Indian Evidence Act, 1872?
output: The opposing party may object to the evidence being given until the document is produced or until facts have been proved which entitle the party who called the witness to give secondary evidence of it.
source_instruction: Explain Section 144 of the Indian Evidence Act, 1872.

instruction: If a theft occurs and the stolen goods are later found in the accused's home, where can the case be tried?
output: A Court within whose local jurisdiction the offence was committed or the stolen property which is the subject of the offence was possessed by any person committing it or by any person who received or retained such property knowing or having reason to believe it to be stolen property.
source_instruction: Explain Section 181 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a Catholic priest refuses to marry two individuals in his church because they are from different denominations, what can another minister do according to Section 59 of the Indian Divorce Act, 1869?
output: any other Minister in Holy Orders of the said Church, entitled to officiate within the diocese in which such Church or Chapel is situate, to perform such marriage-service in such Church or Chapel
