source_instruction: Summarize Section 37 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a will clearly states that all assets should go to one person and there are no other details, can someone bring evidence to prove they were also intended to inherit something?
output: No, if the language used in the will is plain and it applies accurately to the existing facts, evidence may not be given to show that it was not meant to apply to such facts.
source_instruction: Explain Section 94 (Exclusion of evidence against application of document to existing facts) in simple terms.

instruction: If a rape case is being tried, how should the court handle public access compared to other cases?
output: The inquiry into and trial of rape shall be conducted in camera. However, the presiding Judge may, if he thinks fit, or on an application made by either of the parties, allow any particular person to have access to, or be or remain in, the room or building used by the Court.
source_instruction: Explain Section 327 (Court to be open) in simple terms.

instruction: If a witness refuses to produce a document in their possession, what can the court do according to Section 162 of the Indian Evidence Act, 1872?
output: The court may inspect the document, unless it refers to matters of state, or take other evidence to determine on its admissibility.
source_instruction: What does Section 162 of Indian Evidence Act, 1872 state?

instruction: If a person sells a piece of land and the sale agreement is written down, how can they prove the terms of the sale in court?
output: The terms of the sale can be proven in court by presenting the written document itself or through secondary evidence of its contents if secondary evidence is admissible under the provisions hereinbefore contained.
source_instruction: Explain Section 91 (Evidence of terms of contracts, grants and other dispositions of property reduced to form of document) in simple terms.

instruction: Can a police officer who was involved in investigating a crime be appointed as an assistant public prosecutor for the same case?
output: No, a police officer who has taken any part in the investigation into the offence with respect to which the accused is being prosecuted cannot be appointed as an assistant public prosecutor.
source_instruction: What does Section 25 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: If a petitioner wants to serve a divorce petition on their spouse who lives abroad, what can they do according to Section 50 of the Indian Divorce Act, 1869?
output: The petition can be served on the spouse either within or without India, in such manner as the High Court by general or special order from time to time directs.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 50 of Indian Divorce Act, 1869.

instruction: What does 'a false document or electronic record' refer to according to Section 470 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: a false document or electronic record made wholly or in part by forgery
source_instruction: Summarize Section 470 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If someone is caught buying dies for the purpose of counterfeiting coins, what kind of punishment can they face according to Section 234 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: What does Section 234 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 state?

instruction: If someone intentionally runs their boat onto the shore with the intention of stealing items from it, what kind of punishment can they face according to Section 439?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Explain Section 439 (Punishment for intentionally running vessel aground or ashore with intent to commit theft, etc.) in simple terms.

instruction: If two events happened on the same day but in different locations, can both be considered relevant evidence if they are part of the same transaction?
output: Yes, if the two events are connected and form part of the same transaction, they can be considered relevant evidence even if they occurred at different locations.
source_instruction: Explain Section 6 (Relevancy of facts forming part of same transaction) in simple terms.

instruction: What happened to Section 58 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860 after the Code of Criminal Procedure (Amendment) Act, 1955 was passed?
output: Section 58 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860 was repealed by the Code of Criminal Procedure (Amendment) Act, 1955 through Section 117 and Schedule.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 58 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If an indorsee makes a material alteration on a negotiable instrument, what happens to the indorser's liability?
output: Any such alteration, if made by an indorsee, discharges his indorser from all liability to him in respect of the consideration thereof.
source_instruction: What does Section 87 of Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881 state?

instruction: If A instigates B to commit theft, but B does not actually commit the theft, has A committed abetment under Section 107 of the Indian Penal Code?
output: No, because the act or illegal omission must take place in pursuance of the conspiracy and in order to the doing of that thing.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 107 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a person is asked to produce a document but not questioned about its contents, can they be cross-examined on other matters related to the case?
output: No, if a person is summoned to produce a document but not called as a witness, they cannot be cross-examined on any matter, including other related matters.
source_instruction: Explain Section 139 (Cross-examination of person called to produce a document) in simple terms.

instruction: Can a 17-year-old apply for a conductor's license?
output: No, a person under the age of eighteen years shall not hold, or be granted, a conductor's license.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 31 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a petitioner files a divorce petition under the Indian Divorce Act, 1869, what must they include regarding their relationship with the other party?
output: The petitioner must state that there is not any collusion or connivance between the petitioner and the other party to the marriage.
source_instruction: What does Section 47 of Indian Divorce Act, 1869 state?

instruction: If a victim's family requests compensation for their injured relative, what actions can the court take according to Section 357A?
output: The trial Court, at the conclusion of the trial, if satisfied that the compensation awarded under section 357 is not adequate for rehabilitation, or where the cases end in acquittal or discharge and the victim has to be rehabilitated, may make a recommendation for compensation.
source_instruction: What does Section 357A of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: If a driver is accused of causing grievous hurt through dangerous driving and is later acquitted, how will their driving license be affected according to Section 21 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: The driving licence held by such person shall remain suspended until such discharge or acquittal, as the case may be.
source_instruction: Explain Section 21 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a District Magistrate receives a report that a building is in a condition likely to cause injury due to potential collapse, what can they do according to Section 133 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
output: A District Magistrate may make a conditional order requiring the owner of the building to remove, repair or support the building, or to remove or support any trees within a specified time.
source_instruction: Explain Section 133 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a holder of an accepted bill of exchange enters into a contract with the acceptor that would normally discharge other parties under the Indian Contract Act, what can the holder do according to Section 39 of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881?
output: The holder may expressly reserve his right to charge the other parties, and in such case they are not discharged.
source_instruction: What does Section 39 of Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881 state?

instruction: If someone forges a document and then uses it as genuine, what punishment can they face according to Section 471 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: The person who fraudulently or dishonestly uses as genuine a forged document will be punished in the same manner as if he had forged such document.
source_instruction: What does Section 471 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 state?

instruction: If a woman tries to resist her arrest at night, what can the arresting officer do according to Section 46?
output: The arresting officer cannot use force as the statute specifically states that no woman shall be arrested after sunset and before sunrise, except in exceptional circumstances. In such cases, the woman police officer needs to get prior permission from a Judicial Magistrate.
source_instruction: Explain Section 46 (Arrest how made) in simple terms.

instruction: If a court finds a defendant guilty of either theft or robbery, but cannot determine which offense was committed, how should the defendant be punished according to Section 72 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: The defendant shall be punished for the offence for which the lowest punishment is provided if the same punishment is not provided for both.
source_instruction: Explain Section 72 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If an error in the service of process was made but did not affect the outcome of the case, can the order under Section 47 be challenged?
output: No, if the error, defect or irregularity has not prejudicially affected the decision of the case, then the order under section 47 cannot be reversed or substantially varied.
source_instruction: What does Section 99A. of Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 state?

instruction: If a party wants to move a case from one state's court to another, what steps must they follow according to Section 25?
output: The party must file a motion supported by an affidavit and provide notice to the parties involved. After hearing those who wish to be heard, the Supreme Court can then decide to transfer the case if it deems it necessary for the ends of justice.
source_instruction: Explain Section 25 (Power of Supreme Court to transfer suits, etc) in simple terms.

instruction: If a police officer arrests someone and later decides to release them without any conditions, what is required according to Section 59 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
output: The police officer cannot discharge the arrested person without their bond, bail, or a special order from a Magistrate.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 59 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a city has two magistrates appointed as Chief Metropolitan Magistates by the High Court, what can they do?
output: Both Chief Metropolitan Magistrates will have all or any of the powers of a Chief Metropolitan Magistrate under the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 17 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a Magistrate finds an accused guilty but believes the sentence should be harsher than what they can impose, what should they do?
output: The Magistrate should record their opinion and submit the proceedings to the Chief Judicial Magistrate to whom they are subordinate.
source_instruction: Explain Section 325 (Procedure when Magistrate can not pass sentence sufficiently severe) in simple terms.

instruction: If a person fails to appear as required by a bond taken under the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973, what action can the presiding officer take?
output: The officer presiding in such Court may issue a warrant directing that such person be arrested and produced before him.
source_instruction: What does Section 89 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: If someone verbally insults another person and causes them emotional distress, can this be considered an injury under Section 44 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: Yes, verbal insults that cause emotional distress can be considered an injury as per Section 44 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860 since the statute defines 'injury' as any harm caused to the mind.
source_instruction: Explain Section 44 (Injury) in simple terms.

instruction: If a child under 18 years old commits an offense under Chapter XX of the Indian Penal Code, can any adult report the crime on their behalf?
output: Yes, if the child is under 18 years old and cannot make a complaint due to being under the age of 18, another person can report the crime on their behalf.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 198 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: Why was Section 163 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860 repealed?
output: Section 163 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860 was repealed by the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988 (49 of 1988), Section 31.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 163 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a state transport undertaking wants to operate a stage carriage permit across multiple regions within a state, what action is required according to Section 103 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: the State Transport Authority in any case where the said area or route lies in more than one region
source_instruction: Summarize Section 103 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If someone breaks into a house to steal jewelry but is caught before they can commit theft, what punishment can they face under Section 449 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: What does Section 449 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 state?

instruction: If a person admits to owning a stolen item, can this admission alone prove ownership in a court of law?
output: No, admissions are not conclusive proof of the matters admitted but may operate as estoppels under the provisions hereinafter contained.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 31 of Indian Evidence Act, 1872.

instruction: Can a High Court issue an order under Section 482 to prevent someone from filing frivolous lawsuits?
output: Yes, a High Court can issue such an order to prevent abuse of the process of any court and to secure the ends of justice.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 482 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a case is being tried under the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973, where can I find details on how to specify the time, place, and person involved?
output: Section 212 titled 'Particulars as to time, place and person' falls under the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.
source_instruction: Under which Act does Section 212 titled 'Particulars as to time, place and person' fall?

instruction: If I receive a cheque and it is dishonoured, what do I need to do according to Section 95?
output: You must give notice of dishonour to the prior party within a reasonable time.
source_instruction: Explain Section 95 (Party receiving must transmit notice of dishonour) in simple terms.

instruction: If someone intentionally hurts a police officer while he is on duty, what punishment can they face according to Section 333?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Explain Section 333 (Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to deter public servant from his duty) in simple terms.

instruction: If a person is required by law to report their income to the Income Tax Department and intentionally provides false information, what punishment can they face according to Section 177 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both
source_instruction: What does Section 177 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 state?

instruction: If a Regional Transport Authority grants a stage carriage permit for a specific route, what conditions can they impose?
output: The Regional Transport Authority may attach to the permit conditions such as the specified area or route, commencement date, number of daily trips, exhibition of timetable, margin of deviation from the approved timetable, designated pick-up and drop-off points, maximum number of passengers and luggage weight, free luggage allowance, charges for excess luggage, vehicle type and specifications, maintenance of comfort and cleanliness, carrying of goods along with or instead of passengers, charging according to the approved fare table.
source_instruction: Explain Section 72 (Grant of stage carriage permits) in simple terms.

instruction: If a regional transport authority wants to change the conditions of a stage carriage permit, what process must they follow?
output: The Regional Transport Authority may, after giving notice of not less than one month, vary the conditions of the permit or attach to the permit further conditions.
source_instruction: Explain Section 72 (Grant of stage carriage permits) in simple terms.

instruction: What happened to Section 164 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860 after the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988 was enacted?
output: Repealed by the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988 (49 of 1988), S. 31.
source_instruction: Explain Section 164 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a person is arrested for an offense and resists the arrest, what punishment can they face according to Section 224 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: punishment with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both
source_instruction: What does Section 224 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 state?

instruction: If an accused person appeals against his conviction and the High Court issues a warrant for their arrest, what can happen next according to Section 390 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
output: The Court before which the accused is brought may commit him to prison pending the disposal of the appeal or admit him to bail.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 390 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a person is arrested and later escapes from police custody, under what circumstances can another individual be held responsible according to Section 216 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: If a person who has been ordered to be apprehended by a public servant harbors or conceals the escaped person with the intention of preventing their arrest, then that individual can be held responsible.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 216 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a witness testifies about seeing a suspect at a crime scene, can the defense then ask about a completely unrelated incident during cross-examination?
output: No, the cross-examination must relate to relevant facts but does not have to be confined to the facts to which the witness testified on his examination-in-chief.
source_instruction: Explain Section 138 (Order of examinations) in simple terms.

instruction: If a case is being tried under the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973, and the court needs to apply a specific chapter, where would they find the rules for applying that chapter?
output: Section 265A titled 'Application of the Chapter' falls under the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.
source_instruction: Under which Act does Section 265A titled 'Application of the Chapter' fall?

instruction: If a person tries to persuade a soldier to desert but fails, what punishment can they face under Section 131 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: What does Section 131 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 state?

instruction: If a wife withdraws from her husband's home without any reason, what can he do under Section 9 of the Hindu Marriage Act, 1955?
output: The husband can apply by petition to the district court for restitution of conjugal rights if the wife has withdrawn from his society without reasonable excuse.
source_instruction: What does Section 9 of Hindu Marriage Act, 1955 state?

instruction: If a District Magistrate wants to conduct an inquiry under Section 145, what can they do according to the statute?
output: A District Magistrate can depute any Magistrate subordinate to him to make the inquiry and provide written instructions for guidance.
source_instruction: What does Section 148 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: If a company's financial records show a transaction involving a particular individual, can these records alone prove that individual is liable for the transaction?
output: No, entries in the company's books of accounts alone are not sufficient evidence to charge any person with liability.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 34 of Indian Evidence Act, 1872.

instruction: If someone is caught with counterfeit printing plates for making fake currency notes, what punishment can they face according to Section 489D?
output: imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.
source_instruction: Explain Section 489D of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If an aggregator wants to operate without being forfeited their security deposit, what conditions must they meet according to Section 93 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: The aggregator must comply with the provisions of the Information Technology Act, 2000 (21 of 2000) and the rules and regulations made thereunder.
source_instruction: What does Section 93 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988 state?

instruction: If an employee is caught stealing office supplies from their workplace, what kind of punishment can they face according to Section 381 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Summarize Section 381 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: What can the State Government do regarding traffic signs according to Section 116 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: The State Government or any authority authorised by it may cause or permit traffic signs to be placed or erected in any public place.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 116 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a Chief Judicial Magistrate confers certain powers on an assistant magistrate and later wants those powers back, what can they do according to the statute?
output: The Chief Judicial Magistrate can withdraw the powers by whom such powers were conferred.
source_instruction: Explain Section 34 (Withdrawal of powers) in simple terms.

instruction: If a person is refused delivery of property under Section 85(3), what can they do according to the statute?
output: They can appeal to the Court to which appeals ordinarily lie from the sentences of the first-mentioned Court.
source_instruction: What does Section 86 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: If someone is found guilty of cheating under Section 417, what kind of punishment can they face?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both
source_instruction: Explain Section 417 (Punishment for cheating) in simple terms.

instruction: If a lunatic is currently being held in a public lunatic asylum due to a previous order by the State Government, what happens according to Section 338 when an Inspector-General certifies they can be safely released?
output: The State Government may order the release of the lunatic from the public lunatic asylum if the Inspector-General certifies that the lunatic may be released without danger of doing injury to themselves or to any other person.
source_instruction: Explain Section 338 (Procedure where lunatic detained is declared fit to be released) in simple terms.

instruction: If a bill is accepted for honor but the drawee does not pay, who is responsible for any losses incurred?
output: An acceptor for honour binds himself to all parties subsequent to the party for whose honour he accepts to pay the amount of the bill if the drawee do not; and such party and all prior parties are liable in their respective capacities to compensate the acceptor for honour for all loss or damage sustained by him in consequence of such acceptance.
source_instruction: Explain Section 111 (Liability of acceptor for honour) in simple terms.

instruction: If a contract for the sale of land has been written down and registered as per the Indian Registration Act, 1908, can a party provide oral testimony to prove the terms of the contract during a trial?
output: No, when the terms of a contract have been reduced to the form of a document, no evidence shall be given in proof of the terms of such contract except the document itself.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 91 of Indian Evidence Act, 1872.

instruction: If a cheque is crossed specifically to a particular bank, can it still be negotiated to another bank?
output: No, if a cheque is crossed specifically to a particular bank, it cannot be negotiated to another bank as per Section 124 of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881.
source_instruction: Explain Section 124 of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881.

instruction: If a person is required by law to report their income to the Income Tax Department and intentionally provides false information, what punishment can they face according to Section 177 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both
source_instruction: Summarize Section 177 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a member of the Legislative Assembly is detained under civil process for an ongoing meeting, what happens afterward?
output: The member will be liable to re-arrest and further detention as if they had not been initially released.
source_instruction: What does Section 135A. of Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 state?

instruction: What should a Magistrate do if an accused pleads guilty under Section 241 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
output: The Magistrate shall record the plea and may, in his discretion, convict the accused thereon.
source_instruction: Explain Section 241 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a person applies a false property mark on goods and later claims they did so accidentally, what punishment can they face according to Section 482 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: unless he proves that he acted without intent to defraud, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both
source_instruction: Summarize Section 482 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If the Central Government wants to establish a National Road Safety Council, what actions must they take according to Section 215 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: The Central Government must issue a notification in the Official Gazette to constitute a National Road Safety Council consisting of a Chairman and such other members as the Government considers necessary and on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 215 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a person's driving license is revoked due to a traffic violation, how can they challenge this decision?
output: Any person whose driving license has been revoked can appeal the decision to the prescribed authority within thirty days from when they received the notice of revocation. The appeal must be decided after both parties have had an opportunity to present their case.
source_instruction: What does Section 17 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988 state?

instruction: If someone accidentally injures another person while trying to rescue them from a burning building, can they be charged under the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: No, because the injury was caused by accident and without any criminal intention or knowledge while performing a lawful act (rescue) in a lawful manner (entering the building) by lawful means (physical effort) with proper care and caution.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 80 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a city is designated as a metropolitan area under this section, how will it be treated in terms of criminal proceedings?
output: A metropolitan area will be treated as a separate sessions division and district for the purposes of criminal proceedings.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 7 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a police officer witnesses a person about to commit a cognizable offense, what action is required according to Section 149 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
output: Every police officer may interpose for the purpose of preventing, and shall, to the best of his ability, prevent, the commission of any cognizable offence.
source_instruction: What does Section 149 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: If a statute uses the pronoun 'he' to refer to a person who committed an offense under the Indian Penal Code, 1860, what does Section 8 clarify about this usage?
output: Section 8 clarifies that the pronoun he and its derivatives are used for any person, whether male or female.
source_instruction: Explain Section 8 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If John receives a cheque from a stranger at a bus stop and deposits it into his bank account, can he be considered a holder in due course?
output: Yes, if John received the cheque for consideration, before the amount was due, and without knowing any defects in the previous holder's title, he can be considered a holder in due course.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 9 of Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881.

instruction: If someone writes an article mocking a specific religion's practices, could they be charged under Section 295A?
output: Yes, if the person writes an article with a deliberate and malicious intention to outrage the religious feelings of a class of people by insulting their religion or religious beliefs, they could be charged under Section 295A.
source_instruction: Explain Section 295A (Deliberate and malicious acts intended to outrage religious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or religious beliefs) in simple terms.

instruction: Can you explain when there is no right of private defense according to Section 99 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: There is no right of private defence against an act which does not reasonably cause the apprehension of death or of grievous hurt, if done, or attempted to be done, by a public servant acting in good faith under colour of his office, though that act may not be strictly justifiable by law.
source_instruction: What does Section 99 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 state?

instruction: A magistrate issued a search warrant without proper authority. Can the accused argue that the proceedings should be set aside due to this irregularity?
output: No, the proceedings shall not be set aside merely on the ground of the magistrate not being empowered to issue a search warrant.
source_instruction: Explain Section 460 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If an official from a non-Indian country certifies a copy of a judicial record, under what circumstances can a court presume the document is genuine and accurate according to the Indian Evidence Act, 1872?
output: The Court may presume that any document purporting to be a certified copy of any judicial record of any country not forming part of India or Her Majestys dominions is genuine and accurate, if the document purports to be certified in any manner which is certified by any representative of the Central Government in or for such country to be the manner commonly in use in that country for the certification of copies of judicial records.
source_instruction: What does Section 86 of Indian Evidence Act, 1872 state?

instruction: If a defendant receives a message claiming to be from their lawyer, can the court assume the message is genuine based on the evidence alone?
output: No, the court cannot presume the genuineness of the message solely based on its form and delivery through a telegraph office. The statute specifically states that the court 'shall not make any presumption as to the person by whom such message was delivered for transmission.'
source_instruction: Summarize Section 88 of Indian Evidence Act, 1872.

instruction: If a court orders the execution of a decree under Section 118, what happens to the part of the decree related to costs?
output: The part of the decree related to costs will be executed only after the amount of the costs is ascertained by taxation.
source_instruction: Explain Section 118 (Execution of decree before ascertainment of costs) in simple terms.

instruction: If a bill of exchange is noted for non-payment, under what conditions can someone pay it on behalf of one of the parties liable?
output: any person may pay the same for the honour of any party liable to pay the same, provided that the person so paying or his agent in that behalf has previously declared before a notary public the party for whose honour he pays, and that such declaration has been recorded by such notary public.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 113 of Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881.

instruction: If a Claims Tribunal makes an award for compensation under Section 168, how long does the responsible party have to deposit the amount awarded?
output: within thirty days of the date of announcing the award by the Claims Tribunal
source_instruction: What does Section 168 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988 state?

instruction: If a state government wants to introduce a new bus service on a specific route, what steps must they follow according to Section 99 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: The state government must formulate a proposal regarding the scheme giving particulars of the nature of the services proposed to be rendered, the area or route proposed to be covered and other relevant particulars respecting thereto and shall publish such proposal in the Official Gazette of the State formulating such proposal and in not less than one newspaper in the regional language circulating in the area or route proposed to be covered by such scheme and also in such other manner as the state government formulating such proposal deem fit.
source_instruction: Explain Section 99 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a person owns a motor vehicle and wants to drive it temporarily within their state for a week, what should they do according to Section 43?
output: The owner of a motor vehicle can apply to any registering authority or other authority as may be prescribed by the State Government to have the motor vehicle temporarily registered and such authority shall issue a temporary certificate of registration and temporary registration mark.
source_instruction: Explain Section 43 (Temporary registration) in simple terms.

instruction: If someone knowingly possesses a counterfeit coin and gives it to another person, what punishment can they face according to Section 239?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Explain Section 239 (Delivery of coin possessed with knowledge that it is counterfeit) in simple terms.

instruction: If an appellate court delivers its judgment without directing that the accused should be present, what happens according to Section 387 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
output: The accused shall not be brought up, or required to attend, to hear judgment delivered.
source_instruction: Explain Section 387 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If the state government decides to waive the postage and registration fee for notices sent under the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908, what can they do instead?
output: the State Government may prescribe a scale of court-fees to be levied in lieu thereof
source_instruction: Summarize Section 143 of Code of Civil Procedure, 1908.

instruction: If someone owns a machine that can counterfeit coins but claims they will never use it for that purpose, can they still be charged under Section 233?
output: Yes, if the person knows or has reason to believe that the machine is intended to be used for counterfeiting coins, they can be charged under Section 233.
source_instruction: Explain Section 233 (Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting coin) in simple terms.

instruction: If a court finds it necessary to adjourn an inquiry or trial related to certain sexual offenses, how long can it adjourn the case for?
output: The inquiry or trial shall be completed within a period of two months from the date of filing of the charge sheet.
source_instruction: What does Section 309 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: If a court convicts a person of three offenses and sentences them consecutively to 5 years, 7 years, and 8 years respectively, what is the maximum total time the person can serve?
output: The aggregate punishment shall not exceed twice the amount of punishment which the Court is competent to inflict for a single offence.
source_instruction: What does Section 31 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: If a police officer suspects that evidence related to an ongoing investigation might be hidden in a nearby house, can they enter without a warrant?
output: No, because the statute requires that the officer must have reasonable grounds for believing that the necessary thing for the investigation may be found within the limits of the police station of which he is in charge, or to which he is attached.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 165 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a person is convicted of an offense involving criminal force and another person was dispossessed of their immovable property as a result, can the court order the restoration of possession immediately upon conviction?
output: No, the court cannot order the restoration of possession immediately upon conviction. According to Section 456, the court may order the restoration of possession only if it appears that the dispossessed person was dispossessed due to the criminal force used in the offense, but such an order can only be made within one month from the date of conviction.
source_instruction: Explain Section 456 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a person is taken out of India against their will by someone who has no authority to give consent, can they be considered kidnapped under the Indian Penal Code, 1860 based on Section 360?
output: Yes, if a person is conveyed beyond the limits of India without their consent or the consent of someone legally authorized to consent on their behalf, then that person can be considered kidnapped under the Indian Penal Code, 1860 based on Section 360.
source_instruction: What does Section 360 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 state?

instruction: If A encourages B to commit theft but B commits murder instead, how should A be treated under Section 111 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: A is liable for the murder committed by B in the same manner and to the same extent as if A had directly abetted the murder.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 111 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a Chief Judicial Magistrate refers a case back to another Magistrate after initially making an order, what can they do next according to Section 410?
output: A Chief Judicial Magistrate may withdraw any case from, or recall any case which he has made over to, any Magistrate subordinate to him, and may inquire into or try such case himself.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 410 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: Can a Magistrate order a suspect to provide a specimen signature even if they have not been arrested?
output: No, a Magistrate cannot order a suspect to provide a specimen signature if they have not been arrested in connection with the investigation or proceeding.
source_instruction: What does Section 311A of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: If a man persuades his niece (who is 17 years old) to meet him at a park for a study session but actually intends to have sex with her, what punishment can he face according to Section 366A?
output: he shall be punishable with imprisonment which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 366A of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a person sets fire to someone else's property causing damage, what punishment can they face under Section 438 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment for life. or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.
source_instruction: Explain Section 438 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: Can a High Court modify its own procedures for exercising original civil jurisdiction under the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908?
output: Yes, any High Court (not being the Court of a Judicial Commissioner) can make such rules not inconsistent with the Letters Patent establishing it to regulate its own procedure in the exercise of its original civil jurisdiction as it shall think fit.
source_instruction: What does Section 129 of Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 state?

instruction: If someone breaks into a house to steal jewelry but is caught before they can take anything, what punishment do they face according to Section 450?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term not exceeding ten years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Explain Section 450 (House-trespass in order to commit offence punishable with imprisonment for life) in simple terms.

instruction: If a transport vehicle fails the fitness test and the authorized testing station refuses to issue a certificate of fitness, what must they do according to Section 56?
output: The authorized testing station shall supply the owner of the vehicle with its reasons in writing for such refusal.
source_instruction: Explain Section 56 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a transport vehicle has a valid certificate of fitness, what is required to be done according to Section 56 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: All transport vehicles with a valid certificate of fitness issued under this section shall carry, on their bodies, in a clear and visible manner such distinguishing mark as may be prescribed by the Central Government.
source_instruction: Explain Section 56 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If two courts have decrees against the same piece of property, which court gets to sell and decide claims related to that property?
output: The Court of highest grade, or if both courts are of equal grade, the Court under whose decree the property was first attached will get to sell and decide claims related to that property.
source_instruction: Explain Section 63 (Property attached in execution of decrees of several Courts) in simple terms.

instruction: If a person suspects that the parties involved in a divorce case are colluding, what action can they take according to Section 17 of the Indian Divorce Act, 1869?
output: any person suspecting that any parties to the suit are or have been acting in collusion for the purpose of obtaining a divorce, shall be at liberty, in such manner as the High Court by general or special order from time to time directs, to apply to the High Court to remove the suit under section 8
source_instruction: What does Section 17 of Indian Divorce Act, 1869 state?

instruction: If an instrument is created and signed in a foreign country but follows Indian laws, can an acceptance or endorsement made later in India render the initial agreement valid if it's invalid under foreign law?
output: Yes, even if the initial agreement is invalid according to the law of the foreign country where it was entered into, any subsequent acceptance or endorsement made on the instrument within India will make the agreement valid.
source_instruction: Explain Section 136 of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881.

instruction: If a person is found guilty under Section 404 IPC, what kind of punishment can they face?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: What does Section 404 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 state?

instruction: What does Section 66 of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 deal with after its repeal and replacement?
output: Section 66 of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 dealt with a suit against a purchaser not being maintainable if the purchase was made on behalf of the plaintiff. This section was repealed and replaced by Act 45 of 1988, specifically section 7.
source_instruction: Explain Section 66 ([Repealed]) in simple terms.

instruction: If a person is driving a car and gets into an accident, what action can the police take according to Section 133 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: The police can demand from the owner of the motor vehicle all information regarding the name and address of, and the licence held by, the driver which is in the owner's possession or could be ascertained by reasonable diligence.
source_instruction: Explain Section 133 (Duty of owner of motor vehicle to give information) in simple terms.

instruction: What is the primary purpose of the National Transportation Policy according to Section 66A of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: The primary purpose of the National Transportation Policy is to establish a planning framework for passengers and goods transportation, set up a medium and long-term planning framework for all forms of road transport, and promote competition, innovation, and efficient resource usage.
source_instruction: Explain Section 66A of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a truck with multiple trailers is being registered, how should the registration marks be displayed according to Section 61?
output: The registration mark assigned to each trailer should be displayed in such a manner on the side of the drawing vehicle as may be prescribed by the Central Government.
source_instruction: Explain Section 61 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a court in Nepal (which is outside India) wants to examine a witness located in Delhi, under what circumstances can they issue a commission?
output: Subject to such conditions and limitations as may be prescribed, the provisions as to the execution and return of commissions for the examination of witnesses shall apply to commissions issued by courts of any State or country outside India.
source_instruction: What does Section 78 of Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 state?

instruction: If a person is found guilty of giving false evidence during a trial, what kind of punishment can they face according to Section 193 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: What does Section 193 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 state?

instruction: If a person is arrested and later bailed under Section 442, what happens next?
output: The person will be released upon execution of the bond by the court admitting him to bail. If the person is in jail, the court will issue an order of release to the jail officer who will then release the person.
source_instruction: Explain Section 442 (Discharge from custody) in simple terms.

instruction: Can an appeal be made against a judgment rendered by a Criminal Court under the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
output: Yes, an appeal can be made against a judgment or order of a Criminal Court if it is provided for by this Code or any other law for the time being in force.
source_instruction: What does Section 372 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: If a Claims Tribunal awards Rs. 50,000 to a plaintiff, what steps should the plaintiff take to receive the payment?
output: The plaintiff should make an application to the Claims Tribunal to issue a certificate for the amount to the Collector. Once the certificate is issued, the Collector will proceed to recover the amount in the same manner as an arrear of land revenue.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 174 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a person receives a threatening letter but does not know who sent it, what kind of punishment can they expect under Section 507 of the Indian Penal Code?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years
source_instruction: Summarize Section 507 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If the current fine for a traffic violation is Rs. 500, what will be the revised fine after one year according to Section 199B of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: The revised fine will be increased by such amount not exceeding ten per cent in value of the existing fine, which is Rs. 500. Therefore, the maximum possible increase is 10% of Rs. 500, i.e., Rs. 50. Hence, the revised fine will be Rs. 550.
source_instruction: Explain Section 199B of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a person kidnaps a 9-year-old child with the intent to take money from their pocket, what punishment can they face according to Section 369 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Explain Section 369 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a Regional Transport Authority receives an application for a permit and decides to refuse it based on the number of stage carriages, what must they provide according to Section 80?
output: The Regional Transport Authority must give to the applicant in writing its reasons for the refusal of the same and an opportunity of being heard in the matter.
source_instruction: Explain Section 80 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If an RTA has issued a permit on January 1st, 2023, and later decides to replace it according to Section 80(4), what conditions can they attach to the new permit?
output: No condition other than a condition which was already attached to the replaced permit or which could have been attached thereto under the law in force when that permit was granted shall be attached to the fresh permit except with the consent in writing of the holder of the permit.
source_instruction: Explain Section 80 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If someone intentionally offends another's religious beliefs by making an offensive gesture within their sight, what is the maximum sentence they could face according to Section 298 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year
source_instruction: Summarize Section 298 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If John transfers a cheque in full to Jane and then Jane further transfers it to Mary, can John claim the entire amount from Mary?
output: No, John cannot claim the entire amount from Mary as he was already transferred the cheque in full to Jane and cannot claim the amount from an endorsee in full except by the person to whom it has been indorsed in full.
source_instruction: What does Section 55 of Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881 state?

instruction: If A, B, and C all claim $10,000 from D, under what conditions can A, B, and C initiate an interpleader suit?
output: A, B, and C can initiate an interpleader suit if D has no interest in the $10,000 other than for charges or costs and is ready to pay or deliver it to the rightful claimant.
source_instruction: Explain Section 88 of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908.

instruction: If a person is aggrieved by an order of a Regional Transport Authority and wants to challenge it through the State Transport Appellate Tribunal, how long do they have to file their application?
output: The person has to file the application within thirty days from the date of the order. If the application is filed after the expiry of the said period of thirty days, the State Transport Appellate Tribunal may entertain the application after the expiry of the said period of thirty days, if it is satisfied that the applicant was prevented by good and sufficient cause from making the application in time.
source_instruction: What does Section 90 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988 state?

instruction: If someone is caught with materials for forging currency notes but claims they were going to use them for a legitimate art project, what punishment can they face according to Section 489D?
output: imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.
source_instruction: What does Section 489D of Indian Penal Code, 1860 state?

instruction: Can a friend of the victim file a complaint under Section 498A of the Indian Penal Code if the victim is unwilling to do so?
output: No, a friend of the victim cannot file a complaint as the statute allows complaints only from the person aggrieved, their relatives, or with the leave of the court by any other person.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 198A of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a bill is accepted for honor but the drawee pays it instead of dishonoring, can the acceptor be charged under Section 112?
output: No, the acceptor for honor cannot be charged as per Section 112 of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881, unless the bill has been presented to the drawee for payment and dishonored.
source_instruction: Explain Section 112 of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881.

instruction: If a Magistrate of the second class issues an order under Section 267, what additional step is required before the prison officer can act on it?
output: The order shall not be forwarded to, or acted upon by the officer in charge of the prison unless it is countersigned by the Chief Judicial Magistrate to whom such Magistrate is subordinate.
source_instruction: Explain Section 267 (Power to require attendance of prisoners) in simple terms.

instruction: If a person is found to be of unsound mind and unable to defend themselves, what can a magistrate do according to Section 330 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
output: release the person on sufficient security being given that they shall be properly taken care of and shall be prevented from doing injury to themselves or to any other person
source_instruction: Summarize Section 330 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a state wants to implement electronic monitoring and enforcement of road safety, what actions must they take according to Section 136A of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: The State Government must ensure electronic monitoring and enforcement of road safety on national highways, state highways, roads, or in any urban city within a State which has a population up to such limits as may be prescribed by the Central Government.
source_instruction: Explain Section 136A of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If someone is found guilty of cheating under Indian Penal Code, 1860, what kind of punishment can they face according to Section 417?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both
source_instruction: What does Section 417 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 state?

instruction: If a trial is ongoing and involves charges under Section 376 of the Indian Penal Code, how should the court handle adjournments according to the given statute?
output: In every inquiry or trial involving an offence under section 376, the proceedings shall be continued from day-to-day until all the witnesses in attendance have been examined, unless the Court finds the adjournment of the same beyond the following day to be necessary for reasons to be recorded.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 309 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a police officer threatens a suspect with harsher charges unless they confess to a lesser crime, can their confession be used in court?
output: No, the confession made under such circumstances would be considered irrelevant in a criminal proceeding as per Section 24 of the Indian Evidence Act, 1872. This is because the confession appears to have been caused by a threat from a person in authority, which could make the suspect believe they would avoid a worse outcome by confessing.
source_instruction: Explain Section 24 (Confession caused by inducement, threat or promise, when irrelevant in criminal proceeding) in simple terms.

instruction: If a case was initially reported by a complainant but later an appeal is filed against its decision, what should the Magistrate do according to Section 343?
output: proceed, as far as may be, to deal with the case as if it were instituted on a police report
source_instruction: Summarize Section 343 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: What does Section 230 of the Indian Penal Code define as 'coin'?
output: Coin is metal used for the time being as money, and stamped and issued by the authority of some State or Sovereign Power in order to be so used.
source_instruction: Explain Section 230 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a person is found driving a motor cycle without following the safety measures as per Section 128, what penalty will they face according to Section 194C of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: A fine of one thousand rupees and disqualification from holding a licence for a period of three months.
source_instruction: What does Section 194C of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988 state?

instruction: If a judgment from a previous case is related to a matter of public interest and pertains to the current inquiry, can it be used as evidence? Is it considered conclusive proof?
output: Yes, if the judgment relates to matters of a public nature relevant to the inquiry, it can be used as evidence. However, it is not considered conclusive proof.
source_instruction: What does Section 42 of Indian Evidence Act, 1872 state?

instruction: If an accused was examined by a Magistrate and made certain statements, under what conditions can the Magistrate provide a copy of these statements to the accused?
output: The Magistrate shall furnish to the accused, free of cost, a copy of the statements recorded under section 200 or section 202, or all persons examined by the Magistrate.
source_instruction: What does Section 208 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: If someone alters the appearance of an Indian 10 rupee coin to make it look like a 100 rupee coin, what punishment can they face according to Section 249?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Explain Section 249 (Altering appearance of Indian coin with intent that it shall pass as coin of different description) in simple terms.

instruction: If a person is convicted for robbery and it is found that they took away someone's house through intimidation, can the court order the robber to return the house?
output: Yes, if it appears to the Court that the convicted person was dispossessed of any immovable property by criminal force or show of force or intimidation, the Court may order restoration of possession of that property.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 456 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a document over 30 years old is found in a safe deposit box at a bank, can a court presume the signature on the document belongs to the original owner?
output: Yes, if the court considers the safe deposit box to be a proper custody, the court may presume that the signature on the document, which purports to be in the handwriting of the original owner, is indeed in their handwriting.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 90 of Indian Evidence Act, 1872.

instruction: If a case from District Court A is transferred to District Court B, what happens to the jurisdiction of District Court A over that case?
output: District Court B will have the same powers and perform the same duties as those conferred and imposed by the Code on District Court A.
source_instruction: Explain Section 150 of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908.

instruction: If an Additional Sessions Judge retires and there is uncertainty regarding the next in line, what should be done according to Section 35?
output: The Sessions Judge shall determine by order in writing the Judge who shall, for the purposes of this Code or of any proceeding or order thereunder, be deemed to be the successor-in-office of such Additional Sessions Judge.
source_instruction: Explain Section 35 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If an employee makes a statement regarding company policy while still employed, can this statement be used as evidence against the company in a lawsuit?
output: Yes, if the statement made by the employee regarding company policy would be relevant as against the company in relation to such policy in a suit brought against the company, then the statement can be used as evidence.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 19 of Indian Evidence Act, 1872.

instruction: If a case is brought before a civil court and involves an issue that cannot be addressed by the procedures outlined in the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908, what should happen according to Section 141?
output: According to Section 141, the procedure provided in the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908, shall be followed as far as it can be made applicable in all proceedings in any Court of civil jurisdiction.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 141 of Code of Civil Procedure, 1908.

instruction: If a person finds a valuable watch and helps their friend dispose of it without reporting it as stolen, what kind of punishment can they face under Section 414 of the Indian Penal Code?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both
source_instruction: Summarize Section 414 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: Can a police officer break into a woman's private room to search for a suspect?
output: Yes, if the woman is not the person to be arrested and lives in the premises, the police officer can break open the apartment and enter it after giving notice to the female and providing her every reasonable facility for withdrawing.
source_instruction: Explain Section 47 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If someone is caught making fake government stamps but did not sell them, what punishment can they face according to Section 255 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment for life or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Explain Section 255 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: Can an alien friend who has been given permission by the Central Government file a lawsuit in an Indian court?
output: Yes, an alien friend who has been given permission by the Central Government can file a lawsuit in an Indian court as if they were a citizen of India.
source_instruction: Explain Section 83 of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908.

instruction: If a judge issues a warrant of arrest on Monday, when does it expire if not canceled?
output: The warrant remains in force until it is cancelled by the Court which issued it, or until it is executed.
source_instruction: Explain Section 70 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If there is a local law that requires a different procedure for filing a complaint than what is specified in the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973, how does Section 5 handle this situation?
output: Section 5 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 states that if there is no specific provision to the contrary, then the Code will not affect any special or local law for the time being in force. Therefore, if there is a local law requiring a different procedure for filing a complaint, Section 5 ensures that such local law will still be applicable and will not be overridden by the general provisions of the Code.
source_instruction: Explain Section 5 (Saving) in simple terms.

instruction: What does this section imply about the applicability of its provisions compared to other parts of the Code of Criminal Procedure?
output: This section implies that the provisions of this chapter will always apply, regardless of any conflicting provisions found elsewhere in the Code of Criminal Procedure. Other parts of the code cannot be interpreted in a way that constrains the meaning of the provisions in this chapter.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 265J of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If two individuals, A and B, are charged together for theft and A confesses to having committed the crime along with B, can the court consider A's statement when trying both A and B?
output: Yes, the Court may take into consideration A's confession as against both A and B.
source_instruction: What does Section 30 of Indian Evidence Act, 1872 state?

instruction: If a cheque is issued by a company and the bank account is closed by the company before the due date, under which condition will the cheque be considered dishonored according to Section 76 of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881?
output: if the maker, drawee or acceptor intentionally prevents the presentment of the instrument
source_instruction: What does Section 76 of Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881 state?

instruction: If there is no conductor, cleaner, or attendant in the vehicle, what action must the driver take according to Section 131 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: The driver of the vehicle shall get down from the vehicle himself to ensure that no train or trolley is approaching from either side before the railway track is crossed.
source_instruction: Explain Section 131 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a person is applying for a driving license, what details must the license contain according to Section 10 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: Every learner's licence and driving licence, except a driving licence issued under section 18, shall be in such form and shall contain such information as may be prescribed by the Central Government.
source_instruction: What does Section 10 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988 state?

instruction: If a person is repeatedly causing noise disturbance in a residential area and is warned by the local police not to do so again, what kind of punishment can they face under Section 291 of the Indian Penal Code?
output: simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both
source_instruction: Summarize Section 291 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a document is presented claiming to be a power-of-attorney signed by a Notary Public, what presumption can be made according to Section 85 of the Indian Evidence Act, 1872?
output: The Court shall presume that the document was executed and authenticated by a Notary Public.
source_instruction: Explain Section 85 of the Indian Evidence Act, 1872.

instruction: If a police constable investigated a crime and now wants to prosecute the suspect, can they do so based on Section 302?
output: No, according to Section 302, a police officer who has taken part in the investigation into the offence cannot conduct the prosecution.
source_instruction: Explain Section 302 (Permission to conduct prosecution) in simple terms.

instruction: If a term used in the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988 is not defined within its sections, where can one find its definition?
output: Section 2 titled 'Definitions' falls under the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.
source_instruction: Under which Act does Section 2 titled 'Definitions' fall?

instruction: If a court in India wants to issue an arrest warrant for someone to appear from another country, what should they do according to Section 105B of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
output: The court shall send such warrant in duplicate in such form to such Court, Judge or Magistrate through such authority, as the Central Government may, by notification, specify in this behalf.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 105B of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a company wants to sell a new model of a motor vehicle in India, what steps must they follow according to Section 110B of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: The company must obtain a type-approval certificate from a testing agency after submitting the prototype of the vehicle to be tested. The testing agency will conduct tests to ensure the vehicle conforms to the provisions of the chapter and any relevant rules.
source_instruction: Explain Section 110B of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a suit is filed against the ruler of a former Indian state regarding an event that happened before India's independence, how does this section affect the proceedings?
output: This section applies the provisions of section 85 and sub-sections (1) and (3) of section 86 to the ruler of a former Indian state in a suit based on a cause of action that arose before India's independence.
source_instruction: Explain Section 87B. (Application of sections 85 and 86 to Rulers of former Indian States) in simple terms.

instruction: If a witness has a document in their possession but objects to producing it due to confidentiality concerns, what can the court do according to Section 162?
output: The court may inspect the document unless it relates to matters of state, or take other evidence to determine its admissibility.
source_instruction: Explain Section 162 (Production of documents) in simple terms.

instruction: If someone is found guilty of attempting to wage war against the government of an allied country, what kind of punishment can they face according to Section 125 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, to which fine may be added
source_instruction: Summarize Section 125 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If a promissory note worth Rs. 1000 was partially paid by the debtor and then the remaining amount fails to be paid, how much can the creditor claim from the debtor according to Section 44?
output: The creditor can claim proportionally reduced amount based on the original consideration. If the promissory note worth Rs. 1000 had an original partial payment and subsequent failure of the remaining amount, the creditor can claim a reduced sum proportional to the original consideration.
source_instruction: Explain Section 44 (Partial absence or failure of money consideration) in simple terms.

instruction: If a person is forced to consume alcohol and subsequently commits an offense, can they claim incapacity due to intoxication as a defense?
output: Yes, if a person is forced to consume alcohol and becomes intoxicated against their will, they may claim incapacity due to intoxication as a defense under Section 85 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.
source_instruction: Under which Act does Section 85 titled 'Act of a person incapable of judgment by reason of intoxication caused against his will' fall?

instruction: If a police officer mistakenly attaches the wrong property during an arrest, can they still proceed with the attachment according to Section 466?
output: Yes, the mistake or defect in attaching the wrong property during an arrest does not render the attachment unlawful as per Section 466 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.
source_instruction: Under which Act does Section 466 titled 'Defect or error not to make attachment unlawful' fall?

instruction: If an appellate court decides to take additional evidence under Section 391, what steps must be followed according to the statute?
output: The appellate court must record its reasons for taking additional evidence and can either take the evidence itself, direct a Magistrate to take it, or, if the appellate court is a High Court, direct a Court of Session or a Magistrate to take it. When the additional evidence is taken by the Court of Session or a Magistrate, they must certify such evidence to the appellate court, which will then proceed to dispose of the appeal.
source_instruction: What does Section 391 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: If a judge notes that a witness appeared nervous during their testimony, what action is required according to Section 280 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
output: The presiding Judge or Magistrate shall record such remarks as they think material respecting the demeanour of such witness whilst under examination.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 280 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a husband files for divorce under Sections 2 and 10 of the Indian Divorce Act, 1869, can he still sue his wife for criminal conversation?
output: No, after the Indian Divorce Act, 1869 comes into operation, a husband who has filed for divorce under sections 2 and 10 cannot maintain a suit for criminal conversation with his wife.
source_instruction: Explain Section 61 (Bar of suit for criminal conversation) in simple terms.

instruction: If someone breaks into a house at night intending to steal something, what kind of punishment can they face according to Section 457?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine
source_instruction: Explain Section 457 (Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night in order to commit offence punishable with imprisonment) in simple terms.

instruction: If someone owns a building and knowingly allows it to be used by individuals who plan to join an unlawful assembly, what punishment can they face according to Section 157 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months
source_instruction: Summarize Section 157 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: If someone questions whether an employee signed a document, and you know they typically sign such documents as part of their job routine, how can you use Section 16 to support your case?
output: The existence of any course of business, according to which the signing of such documents would naturally have occurred, is a relevant fact.
source_instruction: Explain Section 16 (Existence of course of business when relevant) in simple terms.

instruction: If an accused files an application for plea bargaining under Section 265B and provides certain statements, can these statements be used for purposes other than the plea bargaining process?
output: No, the statements or facts stated by an accused in an application for plea bargaining filed under section 265B shall not be used for any other purpose except for the purpose of this Chapter.
source_instruction: What does Section 265K of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: If a criminal case was ongoing under the old Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 when the new code came into effect, how should it be handled?
output: Such cases should be disposed of, continued, held or made, as the case may be, in accordance with the provisions of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (5 of 1898), as in force immediately before such commencement.
source_instruction: What does Section 484 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: If a person holds a driving license for cars and wants to add motorcycles to their license, what steps must they follow according to Section 11 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: Any person holding a driving licence to drive any class or description of motor vehicles, who is not for the time being disqualified for holding or obtaining a driving licence to drive any other class or description of motor vehicles, may apply to any licensing authority in the State in which he resides or carries on his business in such form and accompanied by such documents and with such fees as may be prescribed by the Central Government for the addition of such other class or description of motor vehicles to the licence.
source_instruction: Explain Section 11 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a 15-year-old commits an offense that carries a maximum sentence of 10 years in prison, can they be tried by a Chief Judicial Magistrate?
output: Yes, if the offense is not punishable with death or imprisonment for life, a 15-year-old can be tried by the Court of a Chief Judicial Magistrate as per Section 27 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.
source_instruction: Explain Section 27 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

instruction: If a convict is sentenced to life imprisonment for an offense carrying the death penalty and later their sentence is commuted to life imprisonment, how long must they serve before becoming eligible for release?
output: such person shall not be released from prison unless he had served at least fourteen years of imprisonment.
source_instruction: What does Section 433A of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?

instruction: If a citizen is required by law to report a crime to the police but fails to do so, what kind of punishment can they face under Section 176?
output: simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both
source_instruction: Explain Section 176 (Omission to give notice or information to public servant by person legally bound to give it) in simple terms.

instruction: If a group of six people gather for a protest and their common objective is to disrupt traffic, can they be considered as forming an 'unlawful assembly' under Section 141 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: Yes, if the common object of the six people gathering for a protest is to disrupt traffic, they can be considered as forming an 'unlawful assembly' under Section 141 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860, as the common object of the persons composing that assembly is to do something unlawful.
source_instruction: Explain Section 141 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

instruction: What can the Central Government make rules about according to Section 27 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988?
output: The Central Government may make rules regarding conditions referred to in sub-section (2) of section 3.
source_instruction: Summarize Section 27 of Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.

instruction: If a person is convicted of an offense and fails to pay the imposed fine within the given period, what sentence can be passed according to the relevant section?
output: The court can pass a sentence of imprisonment in default of fine as per Section 30 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.
source_instruction: Under which Act does Section 30 titled 'Sentence of imprisonment in default of fine' fall?

instruction: What does 'every expression' refer to in the context of the Indian Penal Code, 1860?
output: every expression which is explained in any part of this Code
source_instruction: Summarize Section 7 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.
